channel.title: Client or source?
channel.description: hello everyone who is viewing this thread, I am currently trying to test rsps's out before I try and code one myself "new to coding" but I've come across a problem and I was wondering if anyone else have or has ran across this with the compiler, furthermore to that, the client will pop up but not load, I feel if the compiler is part of the blame but I'm not sure.

item.title: Client or source?
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

Lol best option to figure out this is to do what I did to easily fix it. I have Eclipse which is an IDE used for mainly Java, and it helps you with what your errors may be and help you fix them. So I would suggest downloading that, bring your client folder into that, and then if you have teamview ill show you the rest

Read full topic

item.title: Client or source?
item.dc:creator: @lovethatdeno lovethatdeno
item.description:
@lovethatdeno wrote:

I have the most recent jdk, I put the pugin in the folder but it still hasn’t worked I think it might have to do with the errors, still havn’t fixed it been trying all day. even with the help topic still didn’t help lol

Read full topic

item.title: Client or source?
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

So go into C:\Program Files (x86)\Java, Find your recent updated jdk then, when your in your jdk file, go up to the search bar and type plugin.

The reason I have (x86) is because I have two program files for this computer, yours might just have C:\Program Files\Java

What jdk version do you have?

Read full topic

item.title: Client or source?
item.dc:creator: @lovethatdeno lovethatdeno
item.description:
@lovethatdeno wrote:

for some reason I can’t find this at all, when I was trying to find the plugin.jar

I deffinitly need better skills to try and find this lol,

you think maybe you can help me?

Read full topic

item.title: Client or source?
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

Ah, okay. Did some research regarding this, and you just have to add the plugin.jar from you jdk. Where is that located?

C:\Program Files (x86)\Java(Your JDK)\jre\lib\plugin.jar.

I have an IDE such as Eclipse, and just added that into the properties and it worked.

If you have a lib folder in your client, copy the jar into it.

Read full topic

item.title: Client or source?
item.dc:creator: @lovethatdeno lovethatdeno
item.description:
@lovethatdeno wrote:

/* Class466 - Decompiled by JODE

  • Visit http://jode.sourceforge.net/
    */
    import java.applet.Applet;

import netscape.javascript.JSObject;

public class Class466 {
public static void method6020(Applet applet, String string, int i)
throws Throwable {
try {
JSObject.getWindow(applet).eval(string);
} catch (RuntimeException runtimeexception) {
throw Class346.method4175(runtimeexception, new StringBuilder()
.append(“tf.a(”).append(’)’).toString());
}
}

public static Object method6021(Applet applet, String string, short i)
		throws Throwable {
	try {
		return JSObject.getWindow(applet).call(string, null);
	} catch (RuntimeException runtimeexception) {
		throw Class346.method4175(runtimeexception, new StringBuilder()
				.append("tf.f(").append(')').toString());
	}
}

public static Object method6022(Applet applet, String string,
		Object[] objects, byte i) throws Throwable {
	try {
		return JSObject.getWindow(applet).call(string, objects);
	} catch (RuntimeException runtimeexception) {
		throw Class346.method4175(runtimeexception, new StringBuilder()
				.append("tf.b(").append(')').toString());
	}
}

Class466() throws Throwable {
	throw new Error();
}

}

I it was already in there before I did anything .-.?

Read full topic

item.title: Client or source?
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

No need, just do what I said above. In class466 in the client folder

Edit: In class466 in the client folder, import JSObject.

Example:

That should solve them all.

For any compiler errors, you may refer to https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,438121.0.html#post_cntfindsymbl to help you understand what is wrong.

Read full topic
